article_node.title: Top Japanese beverage giant Suntory's chief resigns as he faces a drug probe
article_node.summary: Suntory CEO Takeshi Niinami resigned after police began investigating his alleged possession of an illegal drug, possibly a supplement. The company said Niinami would step down for governance reasons, with president Nobuhiro Torii taking full responsibility. Niinami had led the firm since 2014, driving strong growth in sales and profits. The investigation remains ongoing, and it is unclear who will replace him. Suntory shares rose 2.9% after the announcement.
